In a disappointing turn of events, filmmaker Rajkumar Hirani has been accused of sexual assault by a woman who worked with him on his 2017 film "Sanju".
While Hirani has categorically denied the allegations and his lawyer Anand Desai termed the allegations "false, mischievous, scandalous, motivated and defamatory", his fans are definitely crestfallen.
Whistling Woods
With an enviable 100% successful track record of delivering hit films, this definitely comes as a shocker for many.
Twitter
In an article on HuffPost India, the woman, who calls herself as "an assistant", alleged that Hirani sexually abused her more than once between March and September 2018.
